column4: i'm (arch)linux user and my neighbour is buying new laptop...asking which windoze to put on...i told him i'll give him free OS :-) now, he is mostly interested for internet etc. so i wonder if ubuntu netbook edition may be better option than the desktop one?
give him what works for him; test several dists.  show him much.
so that he can spend a few hours with each without changing hd
i believe archlinux is too complicated for him...ubuntu looks like great option... the choice is between netbook & desktop edition?
i'm into dl-ing bunch of livedvds...
i'm a Slacker, i duno from dist-jumping myself :)  give him choices and let him play
that is the essence of LinuxTao :)
it's...but for total beginner, i consider ubuntu is good choice
there's a (in)famous maxim i once read from a blogger years ago; ``when you learn Debian, Ubuntu, Knoppix, etal, etc, you learn the one you installed; when you Learn Slackware, you learn Linux.''
it's BillGates' fault that beginners know almost nothing in-depth about computers
Gates wanted a computer in every car and two in every bedroom; it doesnt help learning. :)
slackware; 3min :) then a lifetime of learning.
repeatedly reinstalling a dist is a good thing.  more practice
indeed...although i could just do LFS to do the full circle :-)
